Documentation.Microsoft Office 365: A suite of cloud-based productivity and collaboration applications that integrates all Microsoft's existing online applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Outlook, and others) into a cloud service.
Documentation.Microsoft OneNote for Business: A digital notebook for capturing, storing, and sharing all kinds of information, optimized for business and team collaboration.
Documentation.Microsoft SharePoint: A web-based collaborative platform that integrates with Microsoft Office, primarily used for document storage and management, and team collaboration.
Documentation.Microsoft Stream: An enterprise video service where people in an organization can upload, view, and share videos securely.
Documentation.Microsoft Visio: A diagramming and vector graphics application that helps in creating complex diagrams like flowcharts, organizational charts, and floor plans.
Project Management.Microsoft Project: A project management software designed to assist project managers in developing plans, assigning resources to tasks, tracking progress, managing budgets, and analyzing workloads.
Project Management.Microsoft Planner: A task management tool that allows users to create, assign, and organize tasks, set due dates, and update statuses, ideal for team collaboration and project planning.
Project Management.Azure DevOps: Provides a range of tools for software development teams to plan work, collaborate on code development, and build and deploy applications.
Project Management.Microsoft Lists: An information tracking app in Microsoft 365 that helps users create, share, and track information and tasks with customizable lists.
Frontend.Microsoft Visual Studio: An integrated development environment (IDE) from Microsoft, used for developing computer programs, as well as websites, web apps, web services, and mobile apps.
Frontend.Microsoft PowerApps: A suite that allows users to build custom business apps that connect to business data stored in the underlying data platform (Microsoft Dataverse) or in various online and on-premises data sources.
Frontend.Visual Studio Code: A free, lightweight, open-source code editor from Microsoft that runs on Windows, Linux, and macOS, supporting debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, and code refactoring.
Frontend.Microsoft FrontPage: A discontinued WYSIWYG HTML editor and website administration tool from Microsoft for the Microsoft Windows line of operating systems.
Backup: Microsoft System Center Data Protection Manager
Apps: Microsoft AppSource (for finding and trying apps)
Service Provider Company.Microsoft Consulting Services: A professional service offering from Microsoft that provides strategic guidance and technology expertise to help organizations achieve their business goals and digital transformation objectives.
Service Provider Company.Microsoft Partner Network: A global program designed to support businesses that want to provide services or build solutions on Microsoft platforms, offering access to resources, training, and support to ensure their success.
Service Provider Company.Azure Managed Services: A range of services provided by Microsoft or third-party service providers that help businesses manage and optimize their Azure-based applications and infrastructure, including tasks like monitoring, maintenance, and security.
Individual Service Provider.Microsoft Certified Professionals: Individuals who have completed the professional certification process by Microsoft, demonstrating their expertise and proficiency in various Microsoft technologies and solutions.
Individual Service Provider.Microsoft Certified Trainers: Professionally certified instructors who are qualified to deliver training on Microsoft technologies, often involved in guiding other professionals through Microsoft certification programs.
Individual Service Provider.Microsoft Certified Solution Developer: A certification for developers that validates their ability to design and build solutions using Microsoft's core technologies, including cloud and web-based solutions.
Certifications.Microsoft Certification Programs: A comprehensive range of certification programs offered by Microsoft to validate the skills and expertise of professionals in various Microsoft technologies and job roles.
Certifications.Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Arc: A certification for individuals who have advanced skills and knowledge in designing and implementing solutions on Microsoft Azure, including aspects like computing, network, storage, and security.
Certifications.Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Fundam: An entry-level certification that demonstrates an understanding of Microsoft Dynamics 365 technology and its applications in business processes.
Certifications.Microsoft Certified: Security, Complianc: A certification that validates the foundational knowledge in security, compliance, and identity management across cloud-based and related Microsoft services.
AI.Azure AI Platform: A comprehensive suite of AI services and cognitive APIs provided by Microsoft Azure to build and deploy AI applications and solutions.
AI.Azure Machine Learning: A cloud-based platform designed for developing, training, and deploying machine learning models, offering tools for all skill levels and seamless integration with other Azure services.
AI.Azure Cognitive Services: A collection of AI services and cognitive APIs that enable apps to see, hear, speak, understand, and even begin to reason, intended to make AI accessible to every developer without requiring machine-learning expertise.
AI.Microsoft Power Virtual Agents: A platform that allows users to create powerful chatbots using a guided, no-code graphical interface, integrated with Microsoft's Power Platform.
AI.Microsoft AI Builder: A feature of the Power Platform that brings AI capabilities to apps and workflows, enabling users to easily add intelligence to their applications with pre-built or custom models.
AI.Azure Bot Service: A managed bot development service that helps in building, connecting, deploying, and managing intelligent bots to interact naturally with users on websites, apps, Cortana, Microsoft Teams, Skype, Slack, and more.
Storage.Microsoft OneDrive for Business: A cloud storage service from Microsoft designed for business use, offering secure file sharing, storage, and collaboration as part of the Office 365 suite.
Storage.Azure Storage Solutions: A set of massively scalable and secure cloud storage services from Microsoft Azure, catering to diverse data storage needs, including blob, file, queue, and table storage.
Storage.Azure Blob Storage: A scalable object storage solution for the cloud by Microsoft Azure, designed to store large amounts of unstructured data, such as text or binary data, accessible anywhere via HTTP or HTTPS.
Storage.Azure File Storage: A fully managed file share service in the cloud, part of Microsoft Azure, offering shared file storage via the standard Server Message Block (SMB) protocol.
Storage.Microsoft StorSimple: An integrated storage solution that manages storage tasks between on-premises devices and Azure cloud storage, designed to reduce costs and improve data protection and efficiency.
Operating System.Windows 10: An operating system from Microsoft with a strong focus on user experience and productivity, offering features like a revamped Start menu, virtual desktops, and universal apps.
Operating System.Windows 11: The latest version of Microsoft's operating system, featuring a redesigned interface, improved performance, and new productivity and social features, emphasizing a more streamlined and modern user experience.
Operating System.Windows Server: A series of enterprise-class server operating systems designed to share services with multiple users and provide extensive administrative control of data storage, applications, and corporate networks.
Operating System.Microsoft Windows Embedded: A family of operating systems from Microsoft designed for use in embedded systems, aimed at specific tools and devices like ATMs, POS terminals, and other industrial equipment.
Operating System.Microsoft Hyper-V: A virtualization technology from Microsoft, included in Windows Server, that allows users to create and manage virtual machines to run multiple operating systems side-by-side.
Devices.Microsoft Surface Line of Products: A series of touchscreen-based personal computing devices designed and produced by Microsoft, including laptops, tablets, and interactive whiteboards, known for their high build quality and innovative designs.
Devices.Microsoft HoloLens: An augmented reality (AR) headset developed by Microsoft, featuring holographic lenses for mixed reality experiences, used in various industries for immersive training, visualization, and collaboration.
Devices.Xbox Series X and Series S: The latest generation of gaming consoles from Microsoft, offering high-performance gaming, fast load times, and backward compatibility with a vast Xbox game library. The Series X is the more powerful version, while the Series S is a more affordable, digital-only option.
Devices.Microsoft Mouse and Keyboard Hardware: A range of ergonomic and stylish input devices designed by Microsoft, including mice and keyboards, known for their quality, comfort, and advanced features.
Devices.Microsoft Band: A smart band with fitness tracking and smartwatch capabilities developed by Microsoft, featuring heart rate monitoring, GPS, and integration with various health and fitness apps. (Note: The Microsoft Band was discontinued.)

Domain.Azure Active Directory: A cloud-based identity and access management service.
Domain.Microsoft DNS: Domain Name System services as part of Windows Server.
Domain.Azure Domain Services: Provides managed domain services like domain join, group policy, LDAP, Kerberos/NTLM authentication.

Performance.Azure Monitor: Comprehensive solutions for collecting, analyzing, and acting on telemetry from cloud and on-premises environments.
Performance.System Center Operations Manager: Monitors the health and performance of server infrastructure.
Performance.Windows Performance Monitor: A tool that measures the performance of a Windows system.
Performance.Azure Application Insights: An extensible Application Performance Management (APM) service for web developers.

Communication.Microsoft Teams: An all-in-one communication platform integrating chat, voice, and video conferencing.
Communication.Outlook: Primarily for email communications, includes calendar and task management.
Communication.Skype for Business: Integrated into Microsoft Teams for audio and video calls, chat, and conferencing.
Communication.Yammer: An enterprise social networking service for private communication within organizations.
Communication.Microsoft Exchange Online: A hosted messaging application providing email services.
Communication.Microsoft SharePoint: Facilitates collaboration with document sharing, integrated into communication strategies.
